quotes.text: Piglet sidled up to Pooh from behind. Pooh! he whispered. Yes, Piglet? Nothing, said Piglet, taking Pooh's paw. I just wanted to be sure of you.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Some people care too much. I think it's called love.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: It is more fun to talk with someone who doesn't use long, difficult words but rather short, easy words like What about lunch?
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: I think we dream so we don't have to be apart for so long. If we're in each other's dreams, we can be together all the time.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: I knew when I met you an adventure was going to happen.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Sometimes,' said Pooh, 'the smallest things take up the most room in your heart.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: How do you spell 'love'? - Piglet You don't spell it...you feel it. - Pooh
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Promise me you'll never forget me because if I thought you would, I'd never leave.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: What day is it? It's today, squeaked Piglet. My favorite day, said Pooh.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: If the person you are talking to doesn't appear to be listening, be patient. It may simply be that he has a small piece of fluff in his ear.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: I used to believe in forever, but forever's too good to be true
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: I'm not lost for I know where I am. But however, where I am may be lost.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: The things that make me different are the things that make me.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Some people talk to animals. Not many listen though. That's the problem.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Did you ever stop to think, and forget to start again?
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: I don't feel very much like Pooh today, said Pooh. There there, said Piglet. I'll bring you tea and honey until you do.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Oh Tigger, where are your manners? I don't know, but I bet they're having more fun than I am.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Piglet noticed that even though he had a Very Small Heart, it could hold a rather large amount of Gratitude.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Sometimes, if you stand on the bottom rail of a bridge and lean over to watch the river slipping slowly away beneath you, you will suddenly know everything there is to be known.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: When you see someone putting on his Big Boots, you can be pretty sure that an Adventure is going to happen.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Don't underestimate the value of Doing Nothing, of just going along, listening to all the things you can't hear, and not bothering.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: I wonder what Piglet is doing, thought Pooh. I wish I were there to be doing it, too.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: If there ever comes a day when we can't be together, keep me in your heart. I'll stay there forever.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Friendship, said Christopher Robin, is a very comforting thing to have.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Just because an animal is large, it doesn't mean he doesn't want kindness; however big Tigger seems to be, remember that he wants as much kindness as Roo.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Think, think, think.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: [A] quotation is a handy thing to have about, saving one the trouble of thinking for oneself, always a laborious business. (The Record Lie)
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: A bear, however hard he tries, grows tubby without exercise.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Think it over, think it under.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: What I say is that, if a man really likes potatoes, he must be a pretty decent sort of fellow.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: It's not much of a tail, but I'm sort of attached to it.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Nobody can be uncheered with a balloon.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: I did know once, only I've sort of forgotten.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Hallo, Rabbit,” he said, “is that you?” Let's pretend it isn't,” said Rabbit, “and see what happens.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Pay attention to where you are going because without meaning you might get nowhere.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: To the uneducated an A is just three sticks.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: She turned to the sunlight     And shook her yellow head, And whispered to her neighbor:     Winter is dead.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: I don't see much sense in that, said Rabbit. No, said Pooh humbly, there isn't. But there was going to be when I began it. It's just that something happened to it along the way.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Pooh, said Rabbit kindly, you haven't any brain. I know, said Pooh humbly.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: I was walking along looking for somebody, and then suddenly I wasn't anymore.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: My spelling is Wobbly. It's good spelling but it Wobbles, and the letters get in the wrong places.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: You can't help respecting anybody who can spell TUESDAY, even if he doesn't spell it right; but spelling isn't everything. There are days when spelling Tuesday simply doesn't count.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: I do remember, and then when I try to remember, I forget.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: We'll be friends until forever, just you wait and see
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: You never can tell with bees.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: There must be somebody there, because somebody must have said Nobody.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: So perhaps the best thing to do is to stop writing Introductions and get on with the book.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: But Piglet is so small that he slips into a pocket, where it is very comfortable to feel him when you are not quite sure whether twice seven is twelve or twenty-two.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: It is hard to be brave, when you're only a Very Small Animal.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: To her- Hand in hand we come Christopher Robin and I To lay this book in your lap. Say you're surprised? Say you like it? Say it's just what you wanted? Because it's yours- because we love you.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: But it isn't easy,' said Pooh. 'Because Poetry and Hums aren't things which you get, they're things which get you. And all you can do is to go where they can find you.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Wherever they go, and whatever happens to them on the way, in that enchanted place on the top of the forest, a little boy and his Bear will always be playing.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: For I am a bear of very little brain, and long words bother me.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Bouncy trouncy flouncy pouncy fun fun fun fun fun. The most wonderful thing about tiggers is I'm the only one!
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: No brain at all, some of them [people], only grey fluff that's blown into their heads by mistake, and they don't Think.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Sometimes I sits and thinks, and sometimes I just sits...
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Organization is what you do before you do something, so that when you do it, it's not all mixed up.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.text: Supposing a tree fell down, Pooh, when we were underneath it?' 'Supposing it didn't,' said Pooh after careful thought. Piglet was comforted by this.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne
